title: How to become perfect in everything - Quora

response.answer_text: Good luck with that project, and let us know how it goes! You can certainly be very talented in many areas, but perfection is both impossible and very subjective. What does it mean to be perfect at art, or at computers? There’s no such thing. You can’t know everything about any one subject let alone about all of them, and the more you study anything the more you come to appreciate the literally infinite depth of absolutely everything. People spend their careers narrowly focused on one subject, and become highly skilled, but never perfect, even at that one thing. The greatest scientists and artists and athletes never say they’ve achieved perfection. And yet you want to be perfect at everything? Sorry, but it’s impossible and absurdly arrogant, really. There’s a saying, “perfect is the enemy of good enough”. What you need to do is work hard, apply yourself, and improve; that’s all you can do, and it’s good enough. Forget about perfection; it’s just not helpful. Work toward concrete improvements, build skills. If you’re going to attain something like perfection in anything, regular practice is the way, so just do that. But to even figure out what perfection might be, in order to attain it, you need perfect judgment. I mean, you want to be perfect at playing guitar, so who’s better, Jerry Garcia or Jimi Hendrix? Which one was more perfect? You’ll need perfect discrimination to evaluate all writers, musicians, thinkers, and artists, just in order to know how to become perfect yourself. And of course you’ll need to study widely. So go for that first. Seek wisdom, and experience, and test yourself, learn your strengths and weaknesses. Be honest, and when you find you’re far from perfect, accept that as the normal human condition, and look for specific ways you can improve. Letting go of perfectionism is one way you might consider.
